TextJPN: 自習状態の授業中は、今の自分の置かれている立場を考えるのに都合がよかった。
TextENG: This free study period was a convenient time to consider where I stood.

TextJPN: 俺は軽く目を閉じ、自分が置かれている理不尽な状態について考えてみることにする。
TextENG: I gently closed my eyes and pondered the ridiculous position I was in right now.

TextJPN: まず…忘れてはならないのは…自分がどれほど危険な状態にあるか、だ。
TextENG: First of all... What I shouldn't forget... was how dangerous of a situation I was in.

TextJPN: 自分は彼女らにとって好ましくないことを知る人間になってしまった。
TextENG: I had fallen out of favor with them.

TextJPN: 大石さんと何度かの接触を重ね、核心に迫ろうとしているかに見える。
TextENG: After interacting with Ooishi-san multiple times, I could see it as I was getting closer to the heart of the matter.

TextJPN: 昨日のおはぎはそれへの警告だと考えるのが妥当だろう。
TextENG: The warning yesterday with the mochi was a good indicator of that.

TextJPN: ……いや、…警告という言い方自体、相も変わらず弱気な言い方だ。
TextENG: ...No... Calling it a warning was just my habit of understating things.

TextJPN: 彼女らにとってあのおはぎは俺を萎縮させ時間を稼ぐ意味しかないだろう。
TextENG: It probably had no meaning beyond stunting my progress and buying themselves some time.

TextJPN: …俺を完全な方法で『消し去る』までの………時間稼ぎ。
TextENG: ...Until they had a method of completely 'erasing' me... They were just biding their time.

TextJPN: 俺が脅しに屈したって、知りすぎた人間には変わらないのだから。
TextENG: Even though they were keeping me under their thumb with threats, it didn't change the fact that I knew too much.

TextJPN: その時、机のひんやりとした手触りが、去年までこの席を使い、そして失踪した男、北条悟史のことを思い出させた。
TextENG: The chilling sensation of my desk made me recall Satoshi Houjou, the boy who was using this seat until last year when he disappeared.

TextJPN: 彼もまた…俺と同様だったのだろうか？
TextENG: Was he also... similar to me?

TextJPN: 余計な事まで知ってしまい……消されてしまった…？
TextENG: Did he learn something he shouldn't have... and was erased...?

TextJPN: ………くそ…！@k　俺は…簡単に消されたりはしないぞ……絶対に…！！
TextENG: ...Damn...!@k I wouldn't... let them get rid of me so easily...@k Never...!!

TextJPN: だが…本当に俺は命を狙われているんだろうか…？
TextENG: But... were they really trying to kill me...?

TextJPN: レナたちを疑いながらも…同時にかばうような、そんな二律背反の気持ちはさっきからずっとあった。
TextENG: I've had these contradictory feelings for a while now. Even though I suspected them... I felt I had to cover for them.

TextJPN: 不審な行動・言動をあれだけ目の当たりにしながらも、こうして朝日の中にいると全部ウソなんじゃないかと思えて……@kいや、思い込もうとしてしまう。
TextENG: Even having witnessed all of their suspicious behavior, a morning like this just made it all seem like an elaborate hoax.@k No, that's just what I want to believe.

TextJPN: 俺は仲間を疑っている？
TextENG: Doubting my friends?

TextJPN: かばっている？
TextENG: Covering for them?

TextJPN: 命を狙われている？
TextENG: My life was in danger...

TextJPN: いない？
TextENG: Or was it?

TextJPN: 本当にずれた論点だった。
TextENG: Actually, I was debating the wrong point.

TextJPN: 自らが置かれている現状を思えば…そんなのはとっくの昔の論点のはずなのだ…。
TextENG: Given my current situation... Those points were something that should have been deliberated on a long time ago...

TextJPN: なぁ……本当に俺は…命を狙われているのか…？@k　レナたちに……。
TextENG: But really... Rena and the rest of them...@k Were they actually aiming to kill me?

TextJPN: そんな俺の煮え切らない思考を、俺の中のもうひとりが罵倒した。
TextENG: The little voice inside me continued to torment me with these unresolvable trains of thought.

TextJPN: 馬鹿かよ前原圭一！！　@rそんなのは決まってるじゃないか！！
TextENG: Are you an idiot, Keiichi Maebara!? The answer should be obvious!

TextJPN: で、…でもひょっとしたら……裁縫針は本当に偶然の、事故かもしれないだろ…？
TextENG: B... But maybe... that sewing needle might have been just an accident, right...?

TextJPN: 裁縫針がどう間違ったらおはぎに混ざるんだ？！　@rお人好しも大概にしろ！！
TextENG: How could you screw up and drop a sewing needle into a piece of mochi!? The benefit of the doubt can only go so far!!

TextJPN: 確かにレナも魅音も…不審な態度や言動があるけど…ひょっとしたら何かの誤解で…。
TextENG: Both Rena and Mion... had acted and behaved suspiciously... but maybe it was all some sort of misunderstanding...

TextJPN: 何の誤解だよ？！@k　@r不審どころか…異常なのは明白だろッ？！
TextENG: What kind of misunderstanding!?@k It wasn't just suspicious... it was outright ludicrous, right!?

TextJPN: レナには嘘を正されただけだし……魅音には昼飯を聞かれただけだし……。
TextENG: Rena just corrected me for lying... and Mion only asked me about what I had for lunch...

TextJPN: そのレナは部屋の前で１時間も聞き耳を立ててたんだぞ？！
TextENG: Rena was standing outside my door eavesdropping for a solid hour!?

TextJPN: そ、それはきっと…俺の電話が終わるのを待ってて……。
TextENG: Sh-She was... probably just waiting for my phone call to end...

TextJPN: １時間もずっと部屋の前で？！　@rそしてそのまま何も告げずに帰るか普通？！
TextENG: For a whole HOUR outside your room!? And is it normal to go home afterwards without saying anything!?

TextJPN: 大石さんに聞かされただろ？！@k　@rレナが前の学校で何をしたかを！！
TextENG: You heard from Ooishi-san, didn't you!?@k About what Rena did at her former school?

TextJPN: で、でも…それはオヤシロさまのせいだって病院で……。
TextENG: B-But... At the hospital, she said it was Oyashiro-sama's fault she...

TextJPN: 「いい加減にしろよ前原圭一。お前、命を狙われてるって自覚、あるのかよ？！」
TextENG: ``Cut it out, Keiichi Maebara. Don't you realize they're out to kill you!?``
Ngh!?

TextJPN: それは自分が、無意識の内に口にした言葉だった。
TextENG: I inadvertently blurted those words out loud.

TextJPN: 自らのあまりにストレートな言葉に…しばし呆然とし、誰かに聞かれはしなかったかと周りをうかがった。
TextENG: Hearing myself say that so directly left me dumbfounded for a few moments. Afterwards, I had to look around to check if anyone else had heard it.

TextJPN: ……今の独り言は…あまりに真を突いていた。
TextENG: My little soliloquy cut a little too close to the truth.

TextJPN: 俺はレナたちから殺意を感じながらも、…心のどこかで、それを否定している。
TextENG: Even though I could feel the murderous intent from Rena and the others... part of me somewhere was still trying to deny that.

TextJPN: この期に及んで…そんな躊躇は命取りだ。@k…それはわかってる。
TextENG: This late in the game... such hesitation could be fatal.@k ...I knew that.

TextJPN: だが…俺は平均的な男子生徒で……ごく普通の生い立ちのごく普通の男なんだよ！
TextENG: But... I was just your average student... a man living his normal, ordinary life!

TextJPN: 先週の日曜日まで楽しく笑い合ってた仲間たちが…自分に殺意を抱いてるなんて…急に信じられるかよ…？！　なぁ…？
TextENG: Do you think I could suddenly believe... that my friends, who I had been happily laughing together with up until last Sunday... now intended to kill me...!? Right...?

TextJPN: 「甘えるな圭一ッ！！！！」
TextENG: ``You're too soft, Keiichi!!!!``

TextJPN: 今度は意識して、自分だけに聞こえるよう下腹に力を入れて小さく叫んだ。
TextENG: This time, I remembered to keep my voice down so only I could hear it.

TextJPN: ひとつわかったことがある。
TextENG: There was one thing I now understood.

TextJPN: 俺は…甘い。
TextENG: I was... too soft.

TextJPN: レナたちがどれほど恐ろしい存在なのかを理解していない。@kいや、理解しようともしていない。
TextENG: I didn't completely understand how dangerous Rena and the rest of them were.@k No, I wasn't trying to understand.

TextJPN: 大石さんの心遣いに甘え、核心に耳を貸さなかった。
TextENG: I was too soft for not listening to Ooishi-san when he was earnestly showing me the heart of the matter.

TextJPN: 落胆したふりをすることで、聞かなかった。@k理解しなかった。@k逃げていた。
TextENG: I didn't listen because I was too busy pretending to be dejected.@k I didn't comprehend it.@k I was just running away.

TextJPN: 俺に理解できないから殺意はない、などという甘えはもう捨てるんだ…！
TextENG: I didn't comprehend it, so nobody had any notion to try and kill me? I needed to get rid of such naive thoughts...!

TextJPN: そう決意したとき、終業の鐘の音が聞こえてきた。
TextENG: As I made that resolution, I heard the bell signaling the end of class.

TextJPN: …早い。
TextENG: ...So soon.

TextJPN: 今日という一日はもう終わりだった。
TextENG: The day was already over.

TextJPN: 食事をした記憶も、授業を受けた記憶も、何も残っていなかった。
TextENG: I didn't recall eating lunch or doing anything in class.

TextJPN: 仲間たちは机を向かい合わせて放課後の部活の準備中だ。
TextENG: My friends were putting their desks together in preparation for club activities.

TextJPN: 今までの俺なら、大喜びであの輪に飛び込んでいくのだろう…。
TextENG: Not long ago, I would probably have happily jumped into that circle...

TextJPN: 「あらあら圭一さん？@k@vS01/04/120400058.　帰り支度とはあんまりですことよー？」
TextENG: ``My, my, Keiichi-san?@k@vS01/04/120400058. How rude of you to even think about leaving!``

TextJPN: 沙都子の口調があまりにいつも通りで……胸が痛んだ。
TextENG: The way Satoko spoke was so typical and familiar... it almost physically hurt.

TextJPN: 「あれ？　圭一くん、今日は都合悪いのかな？　…かな？@k@vS01/02/120200194.　今日こそ二人で大勝利………はぅ…」
TextENG: ``Huh? Keiichi-kun, is today not a good day, I wonder? ...I wonder?@k@vS01/02/120200194. And we were going to win big together... Hau...``

TextJPN: レナの、せっかく楽しみにしていたのに…という表情が辛い。
TextENG: Seeing Rena's expression... which said she was really looking forward to today, was hard to take.

TextJPN: なぁ圭一。……実は大石さんが大悪党で、俺をみんなから引き離すために嘘をついてるんじゃないだろうか…？
TextENG: Hey, Keiichi... Maybe Ooishi-san is just some enormous jerk trying to separate me from the others by lying to me...?

TextJPN: パシーンッ！！
TextENG: Slap!!

TextJPN: 軟弱な考えを追い払うため、自らの手で頬に平手打ちした。
TextENG: Trying to expunge such weak-minded thinking, I slapped myself in the face.

TextJPN: 「け、圭一くん…？」
TextENG: ``K-Keiichi-kun...?``

TextJPN: あぁ…レナは本当に俺を殺そうとしているんだろうか…？？
TextENG: Yeah... was Rena really trying to kill me...??

TextJPN: 誰か嘘だと言って欲しい。@k嘘でもいいから嘘と言って欲しい。
TextENG: I wish someone would tell me it was a hoax.@k I didn't care if it actually was one or not, I just wanted someone to say it was.

TextJPN: ……く、また甘えた考えを…！！
TextENG: ...Guh, yet another weak-willed thought...!

TextJPN: 俺ってヤツは…どうしてこうまで甘いんだ？！
TextENG: How did I ever become this naive!?

TextJPN: 「だ、大丈夫…？　頭痛いの？」
TextENG: ``A-Are you all right...? Does your head hurt?``

TextJPN: 俺がひとり苦悩する様がレナにはそう映ったようだった。
TextENG: Apparently that was how my inner dilemma appeared to Rena.

TextJPN: 「顔色悪いよ？@k@vS01/02/120200198.　ひとりで帰れる？@k@vS01/02/120200199.　…送ってった方がいいかな？　…かな？」
TextENG: ``You're pale!@k@vS01/02/120200198. Can you make it home by yourself?@k@vS01/02/120200199. ...Maybe I should accompany you home, I wonder? ...I wonder?``

TextJPN: 「いや……いい。…ごめん。@k@vS01/01/120100375.ひとりで帰れる。@k@vS01/01/120100376.部活はみんなでやってくれよ」
TextENG: ``No... it's okay... sorry.@k@vS01/01/120100375. I can get home by myself.@k@vS01/01/120100376. Just have the meeting without me.``

TextJPN: 俺が部活に参加しないことを知ると魅音が不満そうに口を尖らせた。
TextENG: Upon hearing that I wasn't going to participate in the club meeting, Mion pouted unhappily.

TextJPN: 「圭ちゃんがリベンジ熱望してたってんで、今日はせっかくこの間の推理ゲームにしたってのになぁ」
TextENG: ``Since Kei-chan was so bent on a revenge match, we were even going to play that deduction game from before too.``

TextJPN: 「圭一さんにはリターンマッチに臨む熱いハートはありませんですの？@k@vS01/04/120400060.　なっさけないですわね～！」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-san doesn't have the burning desire for a rematch?@k@vS01/04/120400060. How pathetic~!``

TextJPN: 低俗な挑発には乗らない。
TextENG: I wouldn't fall for some dumb taunt.

TextJPN: 特に買い言葉も返さず、俺はカバンを掴んで席を立とうとした。
TextENG: Without even a real retort, I just grabbed my bag and was about to get up.

TextJPN: そんな俺の頭に、すっと誰かが手を乗せた。
TextENG: Someone's hand perched itself gently on my head.

TextJPN: 「………圭一、具合悪そうです。@k@vS01/05/120500029.………かわいそかわいそですよ」
TextENG: ``... Keiichi doesn't seem to be well.@k@vS01/05/120500029. ...How very unfortunate.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんだった。
TextENG: It was Rika-chan.

TextJPN: 小さな手で、精一杯の背伸びで俺の頭をよちよちと撫でてくれた…。
TextENG: She was stretched up as far as she could, doing her best to pat my head with her petite hand...

TextJPN: とても気持ちよく、…それがかえって悔しかった。
TextENG: It felt so nice... which made things even harder.

TextJPN: それだけを言い残し、俺は足早に教室を後にした。
TextENG: That's all I said as I quickly left the classroom.

TextJPN: 俺の背中を見ながら、何やら言っているようだったが、俺の耳には届かなかった。
TextENG: They said something to me as I was leaving, but I couldn't make it out.

TextJPN: そのまま昇降口へ向かい、靴を出し、履いて、前へ。前へ。
TextENG: I managed to make it all the way to the entrance in that state of mind. Took out my shoes... put them on, and went forward. Forward...

TextJPN: 心を空っぽにしろ……前原圭一…！
TextENG: Harden that heart... Keiichi Maebara...!

TextJPN: あいつらは…どうしてか知らないけど…俺の命を狙ってる！！
TextENG: They were... for some unfathomable reason... trying to kill me!!

TextJPN: 怪しげな企みをしていて、俺の挙動を虎視眈々とうかがっている連中なんだ！！
TextENG: They were plotting something dubious, watching my every move!!

TextJPN: でも…憎めないッ…！！
TextENG: But... I couldn't hate them...!!

TextJPN: だって……仲間じゃないかッ！！！
TextENG: Because... weren't they my friends!?!

TextJPN: 自らの甘さを悔やむ自分と、それを悔やむこと自体、失ってはならないものを失ってしまったのではないかと悔やむ自分。
TextENG: Part of me lamented my naivete, while another part lamented the fact that I had lost something important by lamenting over it in the first place.

TextJPN: 自分という人格が体ごと引き裂かれてしまうような…そんな感覚だった。
TextENG: It felt like my personality was being ripped in two, along with my body.

TextJPN: もしもこれがオヤシロさまの祟りというものなら。@k…あまりに…辛いじゃないか。
TextENG: If this is what Oyashiro-sama's curse was like...@k Then it was just... too harsh.

TextJPN: なぁオヤシロさま…、あんたの祟りを信じなかったのは俺が悪かったよ…。
TextENG: Hey, Oyashiro-sama... I was wrong for not believing in your curse...

TextJPN: でももう信じる。
TextENG: But I believed in it now.

TextJPN: 絶対信じる。
TextENG: Completely.

TextJPN: あんたの祟りは実在する…。
TextENG: Your curse does exist...

TextJPN: だから、もう本当に……勘弁してくれよ…………。@k頼むよ…………なぁ…。
TextENG: So, seriously... give me a break...@k I beg you... come on...

TextJPN: いつになく、夕食はおいしくなかった。
TextENG: Dinner was unusually bland.

TextJPN: 味はなく、匂いもなかった。
TextENG: It had no flavor or aroma.

TextJPN: …普段なら食欲をそそる味噌汁の湯気ですら、ただの水蒸気としか感じられなかった。
TextENG: ...The miso soup that normally tantalized my appetite instead tasted like nothing but boiled water.

TextJPN: 今夜の食卓には親父も一緒だった。
TextENG: Dad was eating with us that night.

TextJPN: うちでは珍しい部類に入る。
TextENG: It was a rare occurrence in this household.

TextJPN: 仕事に熱が入れば、食う寝るはマイペース。@k時間などお構いなしの親父だ。
TextENG: When he got into his work, he ate and slept on his own schedule.@k My dad never cared about the time.

TextJPN: その親父が食卓に着く、ということは、ちょうど仕事のキリがいいのか、さもなければスランプで不調のどちらかということになる。
TextENG: Since my dad was at the dinner table, it either meant he had just reached a good point to take a break or he was in a slump.

TextJPN: 「とにかく、作家のモチベーションってものを理解してないんだよ、彼は」
TextENG: ``So yeah, he just doesn't understand the motivation creators have.``

TextJPN: 「タイアップの話だって口約束なんでしょ？@k@vS01/00/122700047.　そんなにそりが合わないならきっぱりお断りしたら？」
TextENG: ``Your partnership was just a verbal agreement, wasn't it?@k@vS01/00/122700047. If it's so hard to agree on things, why not just end it?``

TextJPN: 「助け合いの世界だからお互い様だとは思うんだけど…。…これじゃ仕事になぁ…」
TextENG: ``I feel like it's an industry with a lot of back-scratching... but when it gets in the way of business...``

TextJPN: 親父とお袋の会話から察するに、あまりムードのいい会話ではない。
TextENG: I wasn't able to pick out much of my mom and dad's conversation, but I could tell it wasn't a very pleasant topic.

TextJPN: ……まずい食事がさらにまずくなるのも道理だった。
TextENG: ...That, of course, made the disgusting food even less appealing.

TextJPN: 両親のそんなやり取りを見ながら、俺はぼんやりと今日一日続けてきた思考を続けてみた。
TextENG: Staring listlessly at the exchange between my parents, my mind wandered off to the same thought processes I had going all day long.

TextJPN: …身近な友人、いや、友人と思っていた人間たちが信用できなくなった今、俺には味方が圧倒的に不足している。
TextENG: ...Friends close to me—no, they used to be friends. But I could no longer trust them. Right now, I was greatly lacking in allies.

TextJPN: 信頼に足りる人間、いざという時に頼れる人間がまったくいないのだ。
TextENG: People I trusted... people I could depend on when push came to shove. They were something I just didn't have.

TextJPN: …ひとりでも味方がいれば、この絶望的な状況でどれほど心強いことか…。
TextENG: ...Having just one ally would have been incredibly reassuring in the currently hopeless situation I was in...

TextJPN: 箸を休め、仕事の話を続ける両親を見上げてみる。
TextENG: I put down my chopsticks and looked over at my parents, who were still talking about work.

TextJPN: 全てを両親に打ち明ける、という選択肢は一番始めに考えた。
TextENG: The first course of action that came to mind was to tell my parents everything.

TextJPN: 雛見沢の誰もが１００％信用できなくなった今、唯一信用できるのは自分の両親だけなのだから。
TextENG: Currently, there wasn't a single person from Hinamizawa I could trust 100%. That meant the only people I could trust were my parents.

TextJPN: だが……、これまでのことを話したところで、理解してくれるだろうか？
TextENG: But... If I told them everything that happened up until now, would they understand?

TextJPN: たとえばレナ。
TextENG: Rena, for example.

TextJPN: 転校以来、甲斐甲斐しく世話をしてくれ、毎朝迎えに来てくれ、たまにお裾分けまで持ってきてくれるご近所さんのレナ。
TextENG: That neighborly Rena, who was so diligent in looking after me, came to get me every day, and sometimes brought over a share of what she made.

TextJPN: その彼女が俺の命を狙っていると、…どう説明する？？
TextENG: How could I explain... that she wanted to kill me??

TextJPN: どう説明しても、それに理解を求めるのはとても難しいだろう…。
TextENG: No matter how I explained, it would probably be difficult for anybody to comprehend.

TextJPN: 少々浮世離れした親父はとても理解できないだろうし、神経質なお袋なら、俺を引きずってそのまま精神科につれて行くだろう。
TextENG: My somewhat eccentric dad wouldn't understand, and my high-strung mom would probably drag me off to a psychiatrist in the blink of an eye.

TextJPN: 悲しいが…これが俺が築いてきた信頼関係の程だ。
TextENG: Sadly... That was the amount of trust that existed in our relationship.

TextJPN: 仮に理解してくれたとしても…どんなことができる？
TextENG: Even if they did come to understand... what could they possibly do?

TextJPN: 真相を暴けるわけでもなければ、俺の命を守れるわけでもない。
TextENG: Unless they could uncover the truth, they wouldn't be able to protect me.

TextJPN: …いやむしろ……俺から“余計なこと”を知らされることによって、両親も危険にさらされるようになるわけだ…！
TextENG: ...No... By informing them of these 'unnecessary' things, I'd be putting my parents in danger as well...!

TextJPN: 過去の事件の被害者が夫婦丸ごとのことが多かったことを思うと…とても笑えない。
TextENG: Considering that the victims in past incidents were often married couples... I couldn't even joke about it.

TextJPN: この雛見沢から、前原一家という３人家族があっさりと事故で、もしくは蒸発して消えてしまうということもありうるのだ……。
TextENG: For the entire Maebara family to have an accident or to just vanish into thin air... It was easily possible in Hinamizawa...

TextJPN: ここで大事なことは“余計なこと”を知ると危険になる、という点だ。
TextENG: What was important here was that knowing something 'unnecessary' put you in danger.

TextJPN: 気味が悪いのは……どうやってヤツらは自分が“知ってしまった”ことを知ったのか、という点だが…
TextENG: The most unsettling question was... how did they know that I knew...?

TextJPN: 裏返せば、“何も知らない限り”両親に危害は及ばないのではないかという言い方もできるんじゃないか…？
TextENG: ``As long as they didn't know,`` my parents might not fall victim... that was one way to think about it, I guess...?

TextJPN: 少なくとも俺の場合がそうだ。@k“知ってから”おかしくなってしまった。
TextENG: At least it was like that in my case.@k After I found out, things started becoming odd.

TextJPN: …つまりこういうことだ。
TextENG: ...In other words, it meant the following:

TextJPN: 何も知らない両親がいる限り、両親には何も起こらない。
TextENG: As long as my parents didn't know anything, nothing would happen to them.

TextJPN: そんな両親がこの家にいる限り、この家はヤツらからの安全地帯になるというわけだ。
TextENG: Which means that this house would be a safe haven as long as my parents were in.

TextJPN: ……詭弁の上に詭弁を塗り固めた憶測なのはわかっている。
TextENG: ...I knew these were just assumptions based on conjecture on top of conjecture.

TextJPN: この家だけは安全地帯であって欲しいという、俺の弱気が求めたご都合主義だ。
TextENG: Wanting this house to be a safe haven... that was the pinnacle of my weak-willed method of thinking.

TextJPN: …表よりは安全という程度で、…絶対安全ではないことをよく理解しなくてはならない。
TextENG: I had to concede that it was not completely safe... It was only safer than the outside...

TextJPN: 両親が頼りない…、いや、両親を巻き込めないことはわかった。
TextENG: I knew that I couldn't rely on my parents? No... I couldn't risk getting my parents involved.

TextJPN: なら俺に味方してくれるような人は……大石さんしかいないことになる。
TextENG: Then the only person who could be my ally would be... Ooishi-san. Him, and him alone.

TextJPN: 大石さんは現在の俺の状況を理解している唯一の人間だ。
TextENG: He was the only person who understood the situation I was in.

TextJPN: 俺の身の安全こそ軽んじているが、事件解決に情熱を燃やしているのだけは間違いない。
TextENG: He didn't care so much about my safety, but he was without a doubt passionate about solving this case.

TextJPN: ……ちょっと悔しかった。
TextENG: ...It was a bit frustrating.

TextJPN: …こんな事態になった大元は大石さんのせいなのに、その事態を打開するのにまた大石さんの世話にならなければならないとは……。
TextENG: ...Ooishi-san was basically the whole reason I was in this mess. Now to get out of it, I had to rely on him...

TextJPN: つまり……大石さんの目論み通りに進んでいるわけだ。
TextENG: Meaning... it was all going according to his devices.

TextJPN: 俺は海に撒かれた餌で、波間を美味しそうに漂うのが仕事。@k…そして、俺の周りに魚たちが群がってきたところで大石さんがそれを一網打尽！
TextENG: It was just my job to look appetizing while bobbing in the waves as bait.@k ...Then, when the fish started gathering around, Ooishi-san would pull up the big haul!

TextJPN: 少し悔しいが、……それがベストとしか思えない。
TextENG: It was slightly infuriating... but even I thought that was the best course of action.

TextJPN: じゃあつまり……俺はどうすりゃいいんだ？！
TextENG: So, then... what should I do!?

TextJPN: …釣りの鉄則は待ちだ。
TextENG: ...Patience was the first rule of fishing.

TextJPN: 魚が食いつくまで、ひたすらじっと伏して待ち続ける…。
TextENG: Just keep waiting until the fish actually bites...

TextJPN: だが俺は餌じゃない。
TextENG: But I wasn't simply bait.

TextJPN: 食われる直前にあらゆる努力をすることができる。
TextENG: There were lots of ways for me to struggle before being devoured.

TextJPN: ヤツらが仕掛けてきた時、なんとかそれを紙一重でかわし、大石さんに引き継がなくてはならない。
TextENG: When they struck, I needed to somehow dodge just enough and tag out to Ooishi-san.

TextJPN: 無論、簡単ではない。@k…大石さんに継ぐタイミングが難しい。
TextENG: No question, it was going to be hard.@k ...The timing to bring Ooishi-san in would be difficult.

TextJPN: 大石さんは雛見沢じゃなく、町にいる。@kだから緊急時に電話をしても、駆けつけてくれるまでに３０分はかかるだろう。@kこの３０分間を何とか逃げ切らなくてはならない……。
TextENG: He was in the city, not Hinamizawa.@k So if I phoned him in my moment of need, it would take him about 30 minutes to reach me.@k So I needed to run away for those 30 minutes...

TextJPN: たとえば…予め緊急時の待ち合わせ場所を決めておくとか。@k…俺はそこで大石さんが来てくれるまで隠れていればいいわけだ。
TextENG: For example... if we set up a rendezvous point for dire situations or something.@k I'd just have to hide out there until Ooishi-san arrived.

TextJPN: 「…よし………少し…見えてきたぞ…」
TextENG: ``...Okay... I can almost... see it now...``

TextJPN: 疑心暗鬼の暗闇の中にいることに間違いはないが、自分がこれからどう進めばいいのかわかることが、これほど心強いとは思わなかった。
TextENG: I was still being chased around in the dark by boogiemen, but now I knew which way to go. I would never have imagined this would be so reassuring.

TextJPN: そうだ。
TextENG: Oh yeah...

TextJPN: いざと言うときの為に、何か携帯できる武器を用意した方がいいかもしれない。
TextENG: It would probably be best if I had a concealed weapon for when things got rough.

TextJPN: ……代表的なものは折り畳みナイフだろうか。
TextENG: ...Typically, that would call for a switchblade.

TextJPN: だが戦うには心細い。
TextENG: But that wasn't too reassuring for combat.

TextJPN: また、社会的に武器だと認知されている点もよくない。
TextENG: Also, since it was recognized as a weapon by the public, that also wasn't good.

TextJPN: やはり、いざという時は…バットのような長い武器の方が有利だろう。
TextENG: Really, when the time comes... a long weapon like a bat would work in my favor.

TextJPN: 学校に金属バットがあったのを思い出す。@k…あれならいざという時、心強い。
TextENG: I remembered there was a metal bat at school.@k ...I could be confident with that when push came to shove.

TextJPN: …素振りの真似でもしていれば、いつも持っていても不審に思われない。
TextENG: ...If I pretended I was practicing my swing, then it wouldn't be suspicious for me to always carry it around.

TextJPN: …明日、早めに登校して確保しよう。
TextENG: ...I could go to school early tomorrow and secure it.

TextJPN: 武器の所持が、それだけで相手の行動を抑止する効果があるかもしれない。
TextENG: Just possessing a weapon may be enough to deter them.

TextJPN: あともうひとつ…保険だ。
TextENG: Also, one more thing... Insurance...

TextJPN: メモでも書置きでもいい。これからの出来事を簡単に、日記風に書き記しておこう。
TextENG: It could be something like a note or memo. I could write down everything that's happened as a sort of journal.

TextJPN: もしも、俺が“蒸発”してしまっても日記は残る。
TextENG: In case I suddenly vanished, the journal would be left behind.

TextJPN: …大石さんは俺の日記を元にヤツらに復讐をしてくれるだろう。
TextENG: ...With my journal in his possession, Ooishi-san should be able to avenge my death.

TextJPN: 仕事の話に没頭している両親を尻目に、自室へ戻る。
TextENG: I left my parents engrossed in their conversation about work and went back to my room.

TextJPN: さっそく俺はノートのページを破り取り、机に向かった。
TextENG: I tore out a piece of paper from a notebook and made my way to my desk.

TextJPN: ……日記なんて小学校の夏休みの宿題以来だな。
TextENG: ...Last time I wrote a journal was for summer homework in elementary school.

TextJPN: 万が一の時、警察は俺の日記を手がかりにするのだ。@k…だから事実のみを簡潔に書こう。
TextENG: In the off chance something bad happened, the police could use my diary as a lead.@k ...So I should only write down the facts.

TextJPN: 書き出しはどうしよう……。
TextENG: How should I start...

TextJPN: 思いつくままにさらさらっと書き出してみる。
TextENG: I jotted down my thoughts as they came.

TextJPN: “私、前原圭一は命を狙われています”
TextENG: ``I, Keiichi Maebara, am in fear for my life.``

TextJPN: ちょっと苦笑した。よく推理小説に出てきそうなこんな文章を、自らが書く羽目になるとは…夢にも思わなかった。
TextENG: It made me laugh nervously. It was a line that showed up often in detective stories. I never even dreamed that I would be in the type of situation where I'd write it myself.

TextJPN: “なぜ、誰に、命を狙われているのかはわかりません”
TextENG: ``I do not know why they are after my life.``

TextJPN: レナたちを疑わしいと思っているが、確証はない。@k……だからこれ以上のことは書けないだろう。
TextENG: Rena and the others were suspicious, but I had no proof.@k ...And that's why I couldn't write anything more.

TextJPN: あまりにミステリーめいた文章に、自嘲気味に苦笑いしてしまう。
TextENG: I laughed wryly at myself for writing such a passage draped in mystery.

TextJPN: この文字通り謎めいた文章を読んで、警察になんらかのヒントになるだろうか。
TextENG: Would the police be able to get the hint from reading this enigmatic passage?

TextJPN: なることを祈るしかない。
TextENG: I could only pray that they would.

TextJPN: …一番祈りたいのはこの日記の出番が訪れないことなのだが…。@kここでやはり苦笑する。
TextENG: ...What I prayed for the most though, was that this journal never needed to play its part...@k Here, I laughed nervously.

TextJPN: あまりに簡素だったので、思いつくままにもう１行加えてみた。
TextENG: It was too simple, so I wrote down one more line I just thought of.

TextJPN: “ただひとつ判る事は、オヤシロさまの祟りと関係があると言う事です。”
TextENG: ``The only thing I do know is that it has to do with Oyashiro-sama's curse.``

TextJPN: これはさすがに…書き過ぎか…？
TextENG: Was that... too much...?

TextJPN: ……これ以上は書かない方がいいかもしれない。@k……これ以上を書き連ねると妄想日記になってしまう。
TextENG: ...I probably shouldn't write more than that.@k ...If I wrote any more, then it would seem like I was just delusional.

TextJPN: 書き手の冷静さをアピールする意味ではこれ以上のことは、現時点では書くべきではない。
TextENG: In order to appear to the reader that the person who had written this was of sound mind... I chose not to write anything else at that point.

TextJPN: ……新しい事実が判った時、書き足せばいいだろう。
TextENG: ... I just needed to add more as I learned more about the truth.

TextJPN: 俺はそのメモを畳み、どこに隠したものか思案する。
TextENG: I folded the paper and thought about a place to hide it.

TextJPN: ……簡単な場所に隠したのでは、万が一の時、ヤツらに見つけられてしまう恐れがある。
TextENG: ...By hiding it somewhere obvious, there was the chance that 'they' would uncover it instead.

TextJPN: 逆に難解な場所では、誰にも見つけてもらえなくなる危険性がある…。
TextENG: On the other hand, if it was in too obscure of a location, then there was the risk of nobody finding it at all...

TextJPN: 考えた末、俺は壁に掛けてある時計を外し、その裏に畳んだメモをテープで貼り付けることにした。@kその後、元通りに時計を掛け直す。
TextENG: In the end, I decided to take the clock off my wall and stick my folded note on the back of it with scotch tape.@k After that, I put the clock back into its normal position.

TextJPN: …うん。@kとても裏に隠してあるようには見えない。
TextENG: Yeah...@k It didn't look like anything was hidden behind it.

TextJPN: あとは、このメモを『俺に何かがあったとき』両親に見つけてもらえるよう、仕掛けるだけだ。
TextENG: Now I needed to set it up such that, ``if anything happens to me,`` my parents could find it.

TextJPN: 角度を変えて何度か見直し、納得したところで俺は階下へ戻る。
TextENG: I looked at it from countless different angles until I was satisfied and I made my way downstairs.

TextJPN: 両親はまだ飽きもせず仕事の話をしていた。
TextENG: My parents were still talking about work.

TextJPN: しばらく待っても話は途切れそうになかったので、自分から切り出すことにする。
TextENG: It didn't look like it was going to end anytime soon, so I cut in.

TextJPN: 「あー、話し中ごめん！！@k@vS01/01/120100382.　……ちょっと聞いてもらっていいかな」
TextENG: ``Ah, sorry to interrupt!!@k@vS01/01/120100382. ...I have something I want to talk to you about.``

TextJPN: 俺がこういう切り出し方で話すことはないので驚いたのか、両親はぴたっと話しをやめて振り向いてくれた。
TextENG: I'd never started off a conversation like that before, so my parents were both startled. They stopped talking and turned towards me.

TextJPN: 「どうしたの圭一？」
TextENG: ``What is it, Keiichi?``

TextJPN: 「お願いがあるんだけど、聞いてほしいんだ。@k@vS01/01/120100384.……その、もしもだよ？」
TextENG: ``I have a favor to ask of you, please listen.@k@vS01/01/120100384. ...Um, just in case, yeah?``

TextJPN: 「圭一、急ぎの話じゃなきゃ後にしなさい。@k@vS01/00/122600019.お父さんとお母さんはちょっと今、急ぎの話をしてるんだ」
TextENG: ``If it's not urgent, can we do this later?@k@vS01/00/122600019. Right now, Mommy and Daddy have something urgent they're talking about.``

TextJPN: こっちより急ぎの話だとは思えない。とにかく用件を伝える。
TextENG: I didn't think their talk was more urgent than mine. In any case, I stated my request.

TextJPN: 「もしもだよ？@k@vS01/01/120100386.　俺が死んだらさ」
TextENG: ``Just in case, okay?@k@vS01/01/120100386. If I die...``

TextJPN: 両親が目を丸くする。
TextENG: Both of my parents' eyes went as wide as saucers.

TextJPN: 「死んだらさ。@k@vS01/01/120100388.……俺の部屋にある時計、あれを棺に入れてほしいんだ」
TextENG: ``If I die...@k@vS01/01/120100388. I want you to put the clock on my wall in my coffin.``

TextJPN: そうすれば気付いてくれるだろう。@kあの日記のメモに。
TextENG: If they did that, then they'd probably find it. My memoir.

TextJPN: 両親は目を丸くしたまま微動だにしない。
TextENG: Both my parents remained wide-eyed, not moving an inch.

TextJPN: ……無理もないかもしれない。
TextENG: ...I couldn't blame them.

TextJPN: 「あの時計、工作の授業で作ったお気に入りなんだ。@k@vS01/01/120100390.頼むよ」
TextENG: ``I made that clock in shop class and I really like it...@k@vS01/01/120100390. So, please.``
``...What's the matter?@k@vS01/00/122700050. Keiichi...@k@vS01/00/122700051. Did something happen?``

TextJPN: お袋が怪訝な顔でようやく口を開いた。
TextENG: Mom was finally able to ask me with a questioning gaze.

TextJPN: 突然息子がこんなことを言い出したら、普通こういう反応を返すだろうな。
TextENG: Of course, this was a normal response for when someone's son suddenly talked about a subject like this.

TextJPN: 心配をかけて申し訳ないが、今は俺の部屋の『時計』を意識さえしてくれればいい。
TextENG: I felt bad about making them worry, but right now I just wanted them to think about the 'clock' in my room.

TextJPN: シンとして、すっかり居心地の悪い空気になってしまったので、自室へ戻ることにする。
TextENG: With the awkward mood leaving the room in silence, I decided to go back up to my room.

TextJPN: 「俺さ、明日は早くに学校に行きたいからもう寝るよ。@k@vS01/01/120100392.お休み」
TextENG: ``I... want to get to school early tomorrow, so I'm going to bed.@k@vS01/01/120100392. Good night.``

TextJPN: それだけを言い残し、居間を出た。
TextENG: Saying only that, I left the living room.

TextJPN: 明日は早い内に登校し、武器のバットを確保しよう。
TextENG: I needed to get to school early tomorrow and secure that bat.

TextJPN: レナとの登校も今日限りにすべきだ。
TextENG: I should make today the last day I went to school with Rena.

TextJPN: 階段を上る時、お袋が俺の名前を呼んだが聞こえないふりをした。
TextENG: As I climbed the stairs, I heard my mom call my name, but I pretended not to hear her.

TextJPN: 両親に相談できることなど何もない。
TextENG: It wasn't something I could talk about with my parents.

TextJPN: 相談すれば…その分、危険が増えるだけだ。
TextENG: If I talked about it... it would only make things more dangerous.

TextJPN: 誰にも頼ることのできない、俺だけの、たったひとりの戦いが始まる。
TextENG: The fight that had begun was mine and mine alone, I couldn't rely on anybody.

TextJPN: 俺は殺されない。@k…こんなわけも判らない内には…絶対に。
TextENG: I wouldn't be killed...@k Not when I still knew nothing...
